metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9575 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Ipa versions 4.2.x, 4.3.x before 4.3.3 and 4.4.x before 4.4.3 did notproperly check the user's permissions while modifying certificate profilesin IdM's certprofile-mod command. An authenticated, unprivileged attackercould use this flaw to modify profiles to issue certificates with arbitrarynaming or key usage information and subsequently use such certificates forother attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeipa-admintools - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-client - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-client-samba - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-common - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-server - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-server-dns - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-server-trust-ad - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-tests - 4.4.4-1
python3-ipaclient - 4.4.4-1
python3-ipalib - 4.4.4-1
python3-ipaserver - 4.4.4-1
python3-ipatests - 4.4.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeipa package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.4-1').
